intro: Serpicula brasiliensis, commonly known as the Brazilian serpentine, is a flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers arranged in a compact inflorescence. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments, often in forest understories. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a rough texture, while its stems are wiry and somewhat succulent. Serpicula brasiliensis is notable for its ability to thrive in nutrient-poor soils, making it an important component of certain ecosystems.
